title: Teacher-Student Interaction Assessment Design to Promote Higher-Order Thinking in Smart Classrooms

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and introductory instructional experience in elementary education settings
context.additional_context: Aims to cultivate pre-service teachers' ability to observe and evaluate HOTS (Higher Order Thinking Skills)-based interactions in smart classroom settings. Operated in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments with formative assessments providing real-time feedback

learning_goals: Learners can observe teacher-student interactions in smart classroom environments according to Bloomâ€™s six-level taxonomy (remembering, understanding, applying, analyzing, evaluating, creating) and utilize recording tools.

Learners can evaluate interaction quality based on five core indicators (questioning strategies, feedback types, collaborative structures, technology integration, cognitive challenge levels) and 18 sub-elements.
Learners can apply the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) to calculate weights for interaction evaluation items and propose priority-based improvement plans.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
